body: Does it work with mingw64?  We dropped support for mingw32 last week, see commit 4613cc916a99674bc562090eacdb6259cafce765.
@bnoordhuis That's on master though, on v1.x we technically still support the older MinGW. That said, it's kind-of "support it yourself", so the PRs are welcome rule applies, I guess :-)
@Choonster any reason why you are not using / can't use MSYS2? It's so much better these days.

I just reinstalled MinGW to confirm that #264 was fixed. There seem to be quite a few forks and related projects, so I wasn't sure which version of MinGW/MSYS to install.

I'll try this on MinGW-w64 and MSYS2.

@Choonster No worries. I can really recommend the MSYS2 installer: https://msys2.github.io/ It'll get you up and running in no time and it comes with pacman from ArchLinux ported to Windows so you can install stuff easily from the command line.

What's the supported way to build libuv in MSYS2?

If I run this:

```
git clone https://github.com/libuv/libuv.git
cd libuv
git checkout a6acc822452b07564c0440bdb7909b7edc805013
git clone https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/gyp.git build/gyp
python2 ./gyp_uv.py -f make
make -C out
```

I get this error from `make`:

```
make: Entering directory '/c/Users/USER/Documents/libuv/MSYS2/libuv/out'
Makefile:317: ../run-tests.target.mk: No such file or directory
make: *** No rule to make target '../run-tests.target.mk'.  Stop.
make: Leaving directory '/c/Users/USER/Documents/libuv/MSYS2/libuv/out'
```

do `make -C out/Debug`

or use autoconf if you prefer.

If I run `make -C out/Debug` instead of `make -C out`, I get this error:

```
make: *** out/Debug: No such file or directory.  Stop.
```

If I run this:

```
git clone https://github.com/libuv/libuv.git
cd libuv
git checkout a6acc822452b07564c0440bdb7909b7edc805013
sh autogen.sh
./configure
make
make check &>testoutput.txt
```

I get a [large number of compilation errors](https://gist.github.com/Choonster/bc8519949215cbdafb34d9a5b2056ac0).

Am I doing something wrong?

Hum, that's weird. What do you have in the out/ directory, when using GYP? (no need to specify -f make when generating, I think)

For the autoconf build, maybe you're missing the win32headers package? (I think it was called that way).

I'll try to test it myself in a pristine environment and let you know.
The only file in the out/ directory after running GYP is [this Makefile](https://gist.github.com/Choonster/6e4b4d3ce5bf6b144f5097bc0ba7f06e).

Ok, I rebuilt my MSYS2 environment from scratch. Here is how to do it with autotools:
- Start the MinGW-w64 Win64 shell (this is important, the MSYS2 shell won't do)
- Install the gcc toolchain and development tools:  `pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-toolchain base-devel`
- Do the autoconf dance

Looks like GYP doesn't quite work (out of the box, that is) with MinGW, so you're better off using autotools.

After installing those packages it now compiles using autoconf (with some warnings), but the `fs_symlink_dir` test is failing.

I've uploaded the build and test output [here](https://gist.github.com/Choonster/cbf095a1504c9a0f4e46d214e3692bc5).

The commands I ran:

```
git clone https://github.com/libuv/libuv.git
cd libuv
git checkout be0e24c1e85ed27c03df4e500299ceedac57bab3

sh autogen.sh
./configure

make
make check &>testoutput.txt
```

Running `make install` after this outputs `make: *** No rule to make target 'install'.  Stop.`.

For anyone still looking for a solution for the original issue with MinGW, it may be to copy the implementation of `_InterlockedOr` from an old version of MinGW-w64: https://sourceforge.net/p/mingw-w64/mingw-w64/ci/3d41592c81b83f383d85b2bd17aa0de8c791632a/tree/mingw-w64-crt/intrincs/ilockor.c to `src/win/tty.c`. But the tests fail, not sure if because of this.
I think this issue got derailed a bit, so I'm going to close it. @Choonster if you see tests fail, please open a new issue, since this one dealt with compilation related issues.  Thanks!
